titles.title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to repeal a requirement that the Under Secretary for Health in the Department of Veterans Affairs be a doctor of medicine.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S13253-13254)

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Mr. Montgomery asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate concurred in the House amendments with an amendment (SP 1604) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/25/1994--Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment. Allows the position of Under Secretary, Deputy Under Secretary, or Associate Deputy Under Secretary for Health in the Veterans Health Administration of the Department of Veterans Affairs to be filled by someone who is not a doctor of medicine if, at the time of any such appointment, the remaining two positions are filled by doctors of medicine. Requires at least five of the ten members of any commission established to select a new Under Secretary to be doctors of medicine.
